intro: Lumnitzera × rosea, commonly known as the mangrove apple or mangrove fig, is a hybrid species within the genus Lumnitzera. It is a tropical evergreen tree that thrives in brackish water environments, often found in mangrove forests. The plant has distinctive, opposite leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a smooth, glossy surface. Its flowers are small and fragrant, typically clustered in catkins, and it produces edible fruits that are astringent when raw but can be used in traditional medicine. This species plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial organisms.
